section.title: Identify the characteristics of an effective leader.
section.subsection: An effective leader:

list.point: Leads by example
Motivates others
Encourage participation, creatvie thinking, and initiative
Demonstrates a postive attitude
Practice active listening skills
Display ethical behavior

section.title: Identify ways to exhibit personal accountability
section.subsection: Ways to exhibit personal accountability include:

list.point: Taking ownership of incidents or requests
Admitting to errors
Adhering to a work schedule
Knowning your responsiblities and fulfilling them
Meeting personal and buisness commitments
Adhering to organization policies and procedures
Representing the organization positively outside the regular work environment

section.title: Identify sucess factors to best manage your work life
section.subsection: Sucess factors to manage your work life include

list.point: Meet commitments with every assignment or meeting
Approach your manager with solutions, not problems
Be open minded--you may not understand why a speific managerial decision is made
Practice your creative and critical thinking skills
Acknowledge those around you for their positive contributions
Identify ways to assist your team and build trust

section.title: Define ethics in business
section.subsection: Ethics in business refers to abiding by principles and codes that guides how members of an organization are expected to behave.  Ethics include integrity, which is the honesty of one's action, and aligning one's value with the values of the organization.

section.title: Describe ethical behavior in a support center.
section.subsection: An ethical support center environment is characterized by analysts who:

list.title: Provide consistent service to all cusotmers
Demonstrate integrity in their actions and daily practices
Take ownership and hold themselves personally accountable for their actions
Protect and enhance the image of the support center
Are loyal to the company, support organization, and team

section.title: Describe how an analyst should be ethical.
section.subsection: An analyst should be ethical by:

list.title: Complying with the company code of conduct
Reporting unethical and unauthorized use of company equipment as outlined in the standard operating procedures
Treating all stakeholders with respect, dignity, and being courtesy
Providing the same level of quality and service to all users in order to remain fair and consistent

UNIT 1: Leadership.title: Role of the Support Center Analyst

section.title: Describe the role of support center analyst in the organization
section.subsection: A frontline support center analyst assumes three main roles

list.title: An Expert--a person with a high degree of business and/or techinical knowledge, skills, or experience. An expert is able to respond to the business issue with the appropriate sence of urgency.

A Customer Champion--a person who advocates for the customer and their needs. A cusotmer champion and their needs. A customer champion represents the cusotmer and focuses on achieving business goals and objectives.

An Expeditor--a person who executes quickly and effectivey. If unable to resolve an issue, an expeditor will escalate the issue to the approprate resource who can resolve the issue, and continue to follow up in a timely manner to ensure the issue has been resolved to the customer's satisfaction.

section.title: Identify the top skills most commonly required of a support professional
section.subsection: The top skills nist cinnibkt reqyured if a support professional include:

list.point: Customer service
Communication skills
Ability to learn quickly
Troubleshooting/problem-solving skills
Ability to work under pressure
Adaptablity
Interpersonal Skills
Teamwork Skills
Self-motivated, independent worker
Support experience

section.title: Describe the primary responsibilities of a support center analyst in the support orgnanization
section.subsection: The responsibilities of a support center analyst include

list.point: Providing high quality customer care on every interaction
Receiving and resolving the initial customer request or incident
Adhering to policy and standard operating procedures
Maintaining product knowledge on a new and existing products and services
Educating the customer and enhancing the customer experience
Providing accurate information and solutions to customers
Staying informed about the changing needs of the business

section.title: Identify how a support center analyst can deliver consistent quaility customer service.
section.subsection: A support center analyst delivers consistent, quality customer service by:

list.point: Responding to customer issues in a timley manner
Understanding and documenting customer needs
Taking ownership of customer inidents.
Making specific commitments, then consistently meeting or exceeding those commitments, while remaining faithful to organizational policies
Resolving or assisting in the resolution of incidents within estblished service levels.
Promoting the value of the support

section.title: Explain how a support center analyst demonstrates value to the organization
section.subsection: A support center analyst demonstrates value to the organization by:

list.point: Performing their role in a consistent quality manner, thus helping the business to achieve its vision and mission
Keeping their cusotmers informed, thus promoting the service offerings to meet the needs of the customers
Promoting and educating customers on teh services that are available, thus increasing the utilization of those services
Managing customer expectations and following up, thus increasing visibility to the service and support center which may result in an icrease in customer statification and leads to customer lolalty

section.title: Define Emotional Intelligence (EI)
section.subsection: Emotional Intelligence (EI) is

list.point: It is important to understand a customer's emotional need as well as their business need
It makes one more aware their own reactions and how it impacts the quality of the relationship between them and customers, peers, and management
It is important to understand how people work and become skilled in creating relationships

section.title: Explain why Emotional Intelligence is important to the role of a support center analyst
section.subsection: Emotional is important to the role of a support center analyst because :

list.point: It is important to understand a customer's emotional need as weell as their business need
It makes one more aware of their own reactions and how it impacts the quality of the relationship between them and customers, peers, and management
It is important to understand how people work and become skilled in creating relationships

section.title: List the three major components of Emotional Intelligence
section.subsection: The three major components of Emotional Intelligence are:

list.point: Self-Awareness
Emotional Management
Emotional Connection

section.title: Describe Self Awareness
section.subsection: Self-Awereness helps to provide a framework grow upon.  This involes self-assessment of oneself, having self-regard, and being optimistic.

section.title: Describe Emotional Management
section.subsection: Emotional Management involves impulse control of one's emotions and controlling one's reponses.  Emotional management involves being adaptable and flexible, having personal drive, and being authentic

section.title: Describe Emotional Connection
section.subsection: Emotional Connection involes relationship building through empathetic listening and communication.

section.title: Describe an emotional hijack
section.subsection: An emotional hijack is a perceived threat, whether it is real or not, from a situation or person.  The limbic brain "hijacks" the executive function and thinking brain.  It is sudden, can be ferocious and takes you where you were not planning to go.  An emotional hijack happens:

list.point: Their is a change in the chemistry of the brain that dose not allow one to think rationally and clearly, which can last for up to 18 mintues.  Tehir are different stages that can cause the brain to go completely blank and revert to fight, flight, or freeze.
The body and brain are flooded with arenaline and cortisol (known as the allostatic load) which can cause one to be over sensitive and/or tired very quickly.

section.title: Explain the impact of an emotional hijack on self and others
section.subsection: The impact of an emotional hijack can leave a person:

list.point: Saying things that may be hurtful without thinking about the consequences
Not able to respond to a situation verbally or physicall
full of natural chemicals that are harmful for the health of the body and brain

section.title: Describe how to manage another's emotional hijack
section.subsection: To manage another's emotioanl hijack:

list.point: Make sure the person individual knows you are on their side to help and/or resolve the issue
Be attentive to the underlying emotion in the conversation through either the vocal elements used or the tone of the written word choice
When faces to face, be aware of the person's body language; keep the door open; and, if appropriate, come back later
Align yourself with the person/individual by identifying and stating their felt emotion with sincerity
Create an enviorment of help by using words like "we" and "us"
Understanding that the person individual is frustrated or angry, feeling pressure to compelete tehir task, and may take that frustration out on you.  Therefore, be pleasant and understanding

section.title: identify signs of an emotional hijack
section.subsection: Signs of an emotional Hijack include:

list.point: Vocal tones becoming very loud
A change in the person's body language
The person becoming withdrawn, giving little or no feedback
The use of negative words or phrases

section.title: Describe how to personally recover after emotional hijack
section.subsection: Strategies to personally recover after an emotional hijack include:

list.point: Remove yourself immediatley from the situation
Take a walk and breathe deeply
Find a mentor or friend away from the situation to talk to
Get something to drink or eat
Count to ten

section.title: Define switch-tasking
section.subsection: Switch-tasking is the tendency to switch between tasks before one is completed.

section.title: Define distraction management
section.subsection: Distraction management is being aware of one's discrations throughout the day that deter a person from accomplishing his/her tasks, plans, goals, or objectives.  Once distractions and its effects have been identified, inteninaol measures need to be put in place to decrease the amount of or impact of the distraction.

section.title: Identify strategies to manage distractions
section.subsection: Strategies to manage distractions include:

list.point: Paying attention to and making note of the number, frequency, type, and time of day interruptions server as distrations, (i.e., e-mail, instant messages, etc)
Identify what needs to be controlled and restrained and devise a plan of action to manage distractions
Talking to your manager about what approriate actions to take to limit distractions
Focusing clearly on one task at a time for as long as possible while limiting those distractions
Putting into practice borders and boundaries that will help you succeed at concentrating on projects and activities

section.title: define effective time management
section.subsection: Effective time managemnt is the act of prioritizing the tasks and limiting distractions in order to maximize the return on personal efficiency and productivity

section.title: Describe the benefits of the effective time management
section.subsection: Beneifts of effective time management include:

list.point: Improved productivity for all parties involed
Improved customer relations
Reduced Stress

section.title: Explain how to manage the use of your time efficiently
section.subsection: Techniques to improve and manage the use of your time include:

list.point: Follow standard operating procedures when performing routine tasks
Use a time management tool or daily "to-do" list
Confirm priorities with your manager, make them aware when competing priorities arise
Prioritize incidents based on documented business impact and urgency
Plan projects and activities in advance, if possible
Prioritize projects and taks in order of importance

section.title: Identifiy ways to be accountable for your own development
section.subsection: To take accountability for your own development

list.point: Understand your strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, threats, and core values.
Get feedback from leadership on your performance
Create an action plan with the feedback
From your career path for the future

section.title: Identify success factors to best manage your worklife
section.subsection: Success factors to best manage your work life include:

list.title: Meet commitments with every assignment or meeting
Approach your manager with solutions, not problems

section.title: Identify ways in which a support customer analyst can initiate personal growth and development
section.subsection: A support center analyst can initiate personal growth and delveopment by:

list.point: Participating in professional development certification course and training
Networking and collaborating with other support professionals via webinars, events, and conferences
Joining and participating in industry groups and online support communities
Sharing knowledge via white papers, articles, blogs, knowledge sharing sessions
Advocate for your personal goals and objectives, make management aware of career goals, aspirations, and development needs
Take initiative to volunteer and work on projects

section.title: Define strategic
section.subsection: Strategic planning is an organized process (occurring at the management level) to define the organization descrited future state, the high-level goals, and objectives of the organization, and the sequence of actions and tasks to achieve them.

section.title: Define stratgey
section.subsection: A strategy is documented plan of action to bring about a future state, such as the organization's goals and objectives.

section.title: Define vision statement
section.subsection: A vision statement is documented view of the future of the organization or business unit.  It reflects an "ideal" picture of what the organization wants to become as viewed by its stakeholders

section.title: Identify the purpose of a vision statement
section.subsection: The purpose of a vision statement is to:

list.point: Inspire pride, commitment, and sense of belonging
Stretch the capabilities and the self image of organization

section.title: Define a mission statement
section.subsection: A mission statement is a formal, short written statement about the stategic purpose of an organization or business unit.  The mission statement should guide the actions of the organization, communicate its overall purpose, provide a sense of direction, and guide decision-making

section.title: Identify the purpose of a mission statement
section.subsection: The purpose of a mission statement is to

list.point: Define the organization's goal and reason for being (i.e., what you are doing and why you are doing it)
Focus everyone on a common goal
Inspire commitment
Provide a sense of direction
Guide decision-making

section.title: Define goals
section.subsection: Goals are the outcome an organization wants to achieve.  The desired endpoint in the support of your strategy.

section.title: Define objectives
section.subsection: Objectives are the milestones to measure progress towards achieving goals.

section.title: Explain the role of a service and support center
section.subsection:
The role of a service support center is to provide advice, guidance, information, and when required, the restoration of normal services to its customers enabling them to achieve their business goals.

A service and support center:

list.point: Serves as the single-point-of-contact (SPOC) for all stakeholders within the business.
Focuses on getting customers back to work as quickly as possible after they have suffered an interruption (incident) or if they need something (request)
Executes activies and tasks within the Request Fulfillment, Access Management, Knowledge Management, and Incident Management processes

Communicate and collaborates with stakeholders to ensure that the service and support provided meets the cusotmer's needs according to the SLA; and improves the customer experience, thus increasing customer satisfaction
